conclusion: Plan to find position at t = 8 seconds using v-t graph.
Initial position is x = 5 m at t = 0.
Area under v-t graph gives displacement.
Position at any time t is initial position plus displacement.
Velocity increases linearly from 0 to 2 m/s from t = 0 to t = 1 s.
Velocity is constant at 2 m/s from t = 1 to t = 4 s.
Velocity decreases linearly from 2 m/s to -1 m/s from t = 4 to t = 5 s.
Velocity is constant at -1 m/s from t = 5 to t = 7 s.
Velocity increases linearly from -1 m/s to 0 m/s from t = 7 to t = 8 s.
Plan to calculate net area under v-t graph from t = 0 to t = 8 s.
Calculate area of first section (t = 0 to t = 1 s) as 1 m.
Calculate area of second section (t = 1 to t = 4 s) as 6 m.
Calculate area of third section (t = 4 to t = 5 s) as 0.25 m.
Calculate area of fourth section (t = 5 to t = 7 s) as -2 m.
Calculate area of fifth section (t = 7 to t = 8 s) as -0.5 m.
